intro: Cabralea pedunculata, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood or cabralea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its slow growth and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
